edu.gatech.seclass.utilities

Class ExternalWebService

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gatech.seclass.utilities.ExternalWebService

  • public class ExternalWebService
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Erin Paciorkowski Created for GA Tech OMSCS CS 6300 Fall 2017 ExternalWebService class to mock cloud DB connection. This mock web service will not sync outside your device and will not persist data after the session. This class is a singleton. Use getInstance() instead of instantiating a new ExternalWebService. *

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ExternalWebService getInstance()
        Use this to get a singleton instance of EWS

      • initializePlayers

        public boolean initializePlayers(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> init)
        Optional initialize players function. Mock EWS will not maintain data when program is shut down. You may use this to imitate it maintaining data, by returning data to it on startup. List of Lists of Strings. A list of players where Each player should be a List of 4+ string = username, firstname, lastname, email, ids for all solved scrambles (in separate strings) * This will not apply extensive validation - do not initialize with inconsistent data.
        Parameters:
        init -
        Returns:
        success

      • initializeScramble

        public boolean initializeScramble(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> init)
        Optional initialize scrambles function. Mock EWS will not maintain data when program is shut down. You may use this to imitate it maintaining data, by returning data to it on startup. List of Lists of Strings. A list of scrambles where Each scramble should be a List of 4 strings = id, solution phrase, scrambled phrase, clue, creator's username. This will not apply extensive validation - do not initialize with inconsistent data.
        Parameters:
        init -
        Returns:
        success

      • newPlayerService

        public java.lang.String newPlayerService(java.lang.String baseUsername,
                                         java.lang.String firstName,
                                         java.lang.String lastName,
                                         java.lang.String email)
                                  throws java.net.SocketTimeoutException,
                                         java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        baseUsername - - the desired username
        firstName - - player's firstname
        lastName - - player's lastname
        email - - player's email (does not verify uniqueness)
        Returns:
        - unique id for the player based on the baseUsername
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketTimeoutException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - for null or blank variables

      • newScrambleService

        public java.lang.String newScrambleService(java.lang.String answer,
                                           java.lang.String scrambled,
                                           java.lang.String clue,
                                           java.lang.String creator)
                                    throws java.net.SocketTimeoutException,
                                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create Scramble
        Parameters:
        answer - - original phrase
        scrambled - - scrambled phrase
        clue - - clue (may be blank "")
        creator - - username of the current player
        Returns:
        - unique id for scramble
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketTimeoutException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - for null or blank required variables

      • retrieveScrambleService

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> retrieveScrambleService()
        Returns:
        A list of scrambles where Each scramble is a List of 4 strings = id, solution phrase, scrambled phrase, clue, creator's username.

      • retrievePlayerListService

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> retrievePlayerListService()
        Returns:
        * A list of players where Each player is a List of 4+ string = username, firstname, lastname, email, ids for all solved scrambles (in separate strings)

        Parameters:

        username - - username for the current player
